title: Support for encrypted JSON keystore
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

The contributors guide includes instructions for running rustfmt and building the
documentation.
-->

## Motivation

This PR adds support for [encrypted JSON keystore](https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/Web3-Secret-Storage-Definition) in the `Wallet` module in `ethers-signers`.

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? In some cases there is not a problem and this can be
thought of as being the motivation for your change.
-->

## Solution

<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->

### Dependencies added:
1. [eth-keystore-rs](https://github.com/roynalnaruto/eth-keystore-rs)

### API
* Create and store a new encrypted JSON keystore
```rust
pub fn new_keystore<P, R, S>(dir: P, rng: &mut R, password: S) -> Result<Wallet, WalletError>
where
  P: AsRef<Path>,
  R: Rng + CryptoRng,
  S: AsRef<[u8]>,
```
* Decrypt an existing encrypted JSON keystore
```rust
pub fn decrypt_keystore<P, S>(keypath: P, password: S) -> Result<Wallet, WalletError>
where
  P: AsRef<Path>,
  S: AsRef<[u8]>,
```

### Tests
Since the `eth-keystore-rs` crate has its own tests, I've only tested the scenario where the signature generated by a random new keystore should match the signature generated when the same keystore is decrypted.

title: Upgrade to Tokio 1.0 and remove async-std
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

The contributors guide includes instructions for running rustfmt and building the
documentation.
-->

## Motivation

Fixes #114 

## Solution

Updates deps to Tokio 1.0. Async-std is no longer a dep.

Blocked on reqwest and tokio-tungstenite releases:
* https://github.com/snapview/tokio-tungstenite/pull/142
* https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/pull/1076

fix: reschedule waker even if receipt is not available
body:
Fixes https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/issues/102

PR #103 did not address the Future hanging when the receipt was not
immediately available, e.g. in non dev environments

title: fix: reschedule waker if receipt is immediately available
body:
Fixes #102 

also updates elliptic-curve/k256/ecdsa/yubihsm deps to latest

title: feat(contract): WS subscription bindings
body:
- Builds on #100 
- Adds `Event::subscribe()` when used with a Ws connection
- Adds subscription-related methods to the `Middleware` trait

title: Contract & Provider eth_subscribe support
body:
Closes #79 

Adds strongly typed eth_subscribe support to the `Provider`, based on rust-web3's implementation & bindings at the middleware & contract level.

title: feat: add a mock transport
body: Adds a mock transport to help us expand our test coverage in more specific situations

title: Misc Fixes
body:
1. Return `Self::Error` from trace* methods so that they can be overriden
1. Replace `impl Trait` syntax with normal generics
1. Only trim the bytes' first 4 bytes if it's an input. Also Error if there was no matching function selector provided

title: add Sync trait to middleware error
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

The contributors guide includes instructions for running rustfmt and building the
documentation.
-->

## Motivation

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? In some cases there is not a problem and this can be
thought of as being the motivation for your change.
-->

Since `Middleware::Error` does not implement the `std::marker::Sync` trait, a middleware error cannot be converted into `anyhow::Error`. This is for convenience of using the `?` operator for a middleware error being returned.

## Solution

<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->

Add `Sync` trait to `Middleware::Error`

title: feat: port over tracing from rust-web3
body: Fixes #87, mostly copied over from rust-web3

title: fix: default param name if not found following memory/calldata
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

The contributors guide includes instructions for running rustfmt and building the
documentation.
-->

## Motivation

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? In some cases there is not a problem and this can be
thought of as being the motivation for your change.
-->

Param parsing failed for a param marked as `memory` but without a param name:
```
bytes memory
```

## Solution

<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->

If no param name is found, return the default param name.

title: feat: allow encoding/decoding function data
body:
Since https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/pull/88 is now merged, we can start exposing more utility methods for encoding/decoding function calldata which may be useful when e.g. decoding data from the `tx.input` field of a transaction. 

- [x] encode/decode function data
- [x] Decode event data
- [x] human readable abi

-->

## Solution

<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->

Refactors the `Contract` struct by extracting the `abi` into a `BaseContract` struct which does only abi encoding. 
Working on adding human-readable abis.

title: Geth TxPool API Support
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

The contributors guide includes instructions for running rustfmt and building the
documentation.
-->

## Motivation

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? In some cases there is not a problem and this can be
thought of as being the motivation for your change.
-->

Fixes #82 

## Solution

The changes are mostly the same as [here](https://github.com/tomusdrw/rust-web3/pull/382/files). In case of `TxpoolInspect`, there is a custom deserializer for `TxpoolInspectSummary`:
```rust
pub struct TxpoolInspectSummary {
    pub to: Option<Address>,
    pub value: U256,
    pub gas: U256,
    pub gas_price: U256,
}
```
that parses plain string info such as:
```
"0x958c1fa64b34db746925c6f8a3dd81128e40355e: 1051546810000000000 wei + 90000 gas × 20000000000 wei"
```
